New Records: England has not been beaten in any of their first 11 meetings with Finland, winning nine of them and playing out two draws.
Pre-Game Insights: England could match an all-time national team unbeaten record when they welcome Finland to Wembley in Tuesday's UEFA Nations League showdown.
If England claim at least a point over Finland on Tuesday, they will equal their all-time men's record for the most games against a single country without ever suffering defeat.
Only three England men's managers have ever won both of their opening matches in charge; Joe Mercer, Ron Greenwood and most recently Steve McClaren, who did so back in 2006.
Captain and all-time record goalscorer Harry Kane is expected to start on what would be his 100th senior appearance for England.
Post-Match Reflections: Carsley aiming to join exclusive England club in Finland match
Miscellaneous Highlights: England out to equal all-time national team record in Finland Nations League clash
